title: Three voted into Reds' Hall of Fame
subtitle: Three voted into Reds' Hall of Fame
body: Three Cincinnati players from three different eras now share at least one common bond.  On Wednesday, former pitchers Tom Browning and Tom Seaver and first baseman Lee May became the three newest members of the Reds Hall of Fame.  "It's an honor to be in the Hall of Fame of the team I grew up loving," Browning said. Mark Sheldon is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Mark Sheldon
